plugin.name: ðŸ”¬Reviews
plugin.description: Commands to help review Project-style notes, GTD-style.
plugin.author: Jonathan Clark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo: Offers Proof of Concept HTML view of '/project lists', requiring NP v3.6.2.

plugin.commands.name: project lists
plugin.commands.description: creates/updates a human-readable list of project notes, including basic tasks statistics and time until next review, and time until the project is due to complete.

plugin.commands.name: start reviews
plugin.commands.description: start a new series of reviews, deciding which are now ready for review, and kicking off the first one

plugin.commands.name: finish project review
plugin.commands.description: updates the current open project's @reviewed() date

plugin.commands.name: next project review
plugin.commands.description: updates this project's @reviewed() date, and jump to next project to review

plugin.commands.name: complete project
plugin.commands.description: add @completed(date) to the open project note, adds its details to a yearly note in Summaries folder (if the folder exists), and offers to move the note to the NotePlan Archive

plugin.commands.name: cancel project
plugin.commands.description: add @cancelled(date) date to the open project note, adds its details to a yearly note in Summaries folder (if the folder exists), and offers to move the note to the NotePlan Archive

plugin.settings.title: Output style to use
plugin.settings.description:
Use Rich (HTML) output where possible? Note: This is an experimental style available from NotePlan v3.6.2, which currently shows a temporary modal window, and doesn't result in a saved note.
Or the original NotePlan (Markdown) output style.

plugin.settings.title: Folder to store (markdown) review notes
plugin.settings.description: Folder where review notes will be stored (will be created if necessary)

plugin.settings.title: Folders to ignore in reviews
plugin.settings.description: A comma-separated list of folders to ignore in reviews. Can be empty. Where an ignored folder has a sub-folder these will also be ignored.

plugin.settings.title: Note type hashtags
plugin.settings.description: A comma-separated list of hashtags to indicate notes to include in this review system

plugin.settings.title: Confirm next Review?
plugin.settings.description: When running '/next project review' it ask whether to start the next review.

plugin.settings.title: Display project dates?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to display the project's review and due dates (where set)

plugin.settings.title: Display project's latest progress?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show the project's latest progress (where available). If a specific 'Progress:' field is set it will use that, otherwise it will calculate %completion based on the number of completed and open tasks.

plugin.settings.title: Display order for projects
plugin.settings.description: The sort options  are by 'due' date, by 'review' date or 'title'.

plugin.settings.title: Display projects grouped by folder?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to group the projects by their folder.

plugin.settings.title: Display archived projects?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to display project notes marked as #archive.

plugin.settings.title: Finished List Heading
plugin.settings.description: Heading of list of completed or cancelled projects/areas

plugin.settings.title: Project start string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was started (default: @start)

plugin.settings.title: Project completed string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was completed (default: @completed)

plugin.settings.title: Project cancelled string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was cancelled (default: @cancelled)

plugin.settings.title: Project due string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area is due to be finished (default: @due)

plugin.settings.title: Project reviewed string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was last reviewed (default: @reviewed)

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin in the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent).
